name: Battered Women's Justice Project (BWJP)
description: BWJP is a collective of national policy and practice centers at the intersection of gender-based violence and legal systems. The organization provides resources, training, consultations, and research to improve civil and criminal justice responses to domestic and dating violence, sexual assault, stalking, and human trafficking. BWJP offers technical assistance to advocates, attorneys, judges, court personnel, law enforcement officers, and other professionals working with survivors of gender-based violence.
source: Verified from official BWJP website and multiple resource directories
eligibility: Available to advocates, attorneys, judges, court personnel, law enforcement officers, and other professionals working with survivors of gender-based violence
notes: BWJP is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization (EIN 46-3584341). The organization recently merged with Global Rights for Women to expand their global impact. They provide comprehensive support for professionals working to end gender-based violence through legal and systemic change.
